thread.title: Shorten promotes younger MPs to take on Turnbull
thread.title_full: Shorten promotes younger MPs to take on Turnbull | afr.com

author: Primrose Riordan
title: Shorten promotes younger MPs to take on Turnbull
text:
Opposition Leader Bill Shorten with his shadow ministerial appointments, from left: Jim Chalmers Superannuation and Financial Services, Sam Dastyari Parliamentary Secretary for School Education and Youth, Michelle Rowland Small Business, Senator Katy Gallagher Mental Health, Housing and Homelessness and Terri Butler Parliamentary Secretary for Child Safety and Prevention of Family Violence at Parliament House on Tuesday. Andrew Meares Share on twitter Share on Google Plus by Primrose Riordan Federal Opposition Leader Bill Shorten is making bigger changes to his frontbench than expected by promoting several younger MPs in an attempt to hit back at the soaring popularity of new Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull.
While former ACT chief minister Katy Gallagher and Jim Chalmers had been expected to be promoted for some weeks, Mr Shorten also gave extra responsibilities or promoted Michelle Rowland, Ed Husic, Sam Dastyari and Terri Butler.
Ms Rowland has joined the shadow cabinet as spokeswoman for small business, while Julie Owens has become to opposition parliamentary secretary for early childhood education.
Queensland MP Terri Butler is the new opposition parliamentary secretary to the Leader of the Opposition, while tech-enthusiast Ed Husic has been given opposition parliamentary secretary for digital innovation and start-ups, which means he will face off against Wyatt Roy, one of the youngest ministers in Australian history.
Opposition Leader Bill Shorten has announced his new Shadow Ministry #auspol pic.twitter.com/fN0pAlrwiY
â€” Political Alert (@political_alert) October 13, 2015 Senator Dastyari has been promoted from the backbench to opposition parliamentary secretary for school education and youth.
"After today's announcement [our shadow cabinet] has more women, even more energy, this will be the team I take to the next election," Mr Shorten said.
"I think I have been fortunate, indeed blessed by the degree of unity in the party. This is the only reshuffle I've had to do on my second anniversary as Leader of the Opposition.
"We haven't needed to make some of the wholesale changes the government did," he said.
 Mr Chalmers, a former chief of staff to treasurer Wayne Swan, will become spokesman for superannuation and financial services, assistant spokesman for trade and investment, assistant spokesman for productivity and spokesman for sport.
Senator Gallagher joins the shadow cabinet as spokesman for mental health, and housing and homelessness, as well as assisting the Opposition Leader on state and territory relations.
